bug.short_desc: rename livereload package to meet python guidelines.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
livereload is an executable, included in the package; but it's more. Even upstream names it python-livereload.
https://github.com/lepture/python-livereload
This package named livereload caused already duplicate work
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1307172

Package python-sphinx-autobuild is a consumer of livereload with support for both py2 and py3.
William, it would be of much help if you can package it for python2 as well.

python-livereload was retired for rawhide, so this will require a package review to unretire.
Can you do the package review? Any way this package was reviewed al tess 3 times but I want to run the test with python2 and this will requiere some adiotional libraries.

(In reply to William Moreno from comment #2) > python-livereload was retired for rawhide, so this will require a package > review to unretire. > > Can you do the package review? Any way this package was reviewed al tess 3 > times but I want to run the test with python2 and this will requiere some > adiotional libraries.
It would require a package review for renaming a package, yes. My reasoning is, this package is named wrong, it should have been python-livereload from the beginning. Please propose a package rename review and add it as dependency to this ticket. I'd be happily review it, if I find the time. You may also ask the (former) maintainer of python-livereload or the reviewer of that package review.

William,
I agree with Matthias. Please file a rename review request for livereload to python-livereload. Create subpackages python2 and python3 as given in sample spec file in https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Python#Example_common_spec_file
If both subpackages need to provide same livereload binary then I suggest to install python2 version as /usr/bin/livereload and python3 version as /usr/bin/livereload-3

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
